title: Leftward shift in SRAS shows cost-push inflation

content.question: The graph above shows aggregate demand (AD), short-run aggregate supply (SRAS), and long-run aggregate supply curves for an economy. Based on the graph, cost-push inflation is caused by a movement from

choices.label: <math alttext="S R A S 1"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><msub><mrow><mi>SRAS</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="S R A S 1"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><msub><mrow><mi>SRAS</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="S R A S 1"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><msub><mrow><mi>SRAS</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="S R A S 1"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><msub><mrow><mi>SRAS</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="S R A S 1"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><msub><mrow><mi>SRAS</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="S R A S 1"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><msub><mrow><mi>SRAS</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 3.6: Changes in the AD-AS Model in the Short Run

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Using economic concepts, principles, or models, explain how a specific economic outcome occurs, or what action should be taken in order to achieve a specific economic outcome.
